mwoauth-desc: Allows usage of OAuth 1.0a and OAuth 2.0 for API authorisation
mwoauthconsumerregistration-propose-text:
You can:
* [[Special:OAuthConsumerRegistration/propose/oauth1a|Propose an OAuth 1.0a consumer]].
* [[Special:OAuthConsumerRegistration/propose/oauth2|Propose an OAuth 2.0 client]].
mwoauthmanagemygrants-text: This page lists any applications that can use your account. For any such application, the scope of its access is limited by the permissions that you granted to the application when you authorised it to act on your behalf. If you separately authorised an application to access different "sister" projects on your behalf, then you will see separate configuration for each such project below. Connected applications access your account by using the OAuth protocol. ([https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:OAuth Learn more about connected applications])
mwoauthdatastore-access-token-not-found: No approved grant was found for that authorisation token
mwoauth-invalid-authorization: The authorisation headers in your request are not valid: $1
mwoauth-invalid-authorization-wrong-wiki: The authorisation headers in your request are not valid for $1
mwoauth-invalid-authorization-invalid-us: The authorisation headers in your request are for a user that does not exist here
mwoauth-invalid-authorization-wrong-user: The authorisation headers in your request are for a different user
mwoauth-invalid-authorization-blocked-us: The authorisation headers in your request are for a user who is blocked
mwoauth-oauth2-error-server-error: The authorisation server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
mwoauth-oauth2-error-unauthorized-client: The client is not authorised to request an authorisation code using this method.
mwoauth-oauth2-error-access-denied: The resource owner or authorisation server denied the request.
mwoauth-oauth2-error-unsupported-respons: The authorisation server does not support obtaining an authorisation code using this method.
mwoauth-oauth2-error-temporarily-unavail: The authorisation server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.
mwoauth-login-required-reason: You need to log into your {{SITENAME}} account to authorise applications to access it.
